sentences.en: A victory for Allende would imperil our interests in the Western Hemisphere.
sentences.cn: 阿连德一旦获胜,就将危及我们在西半球的利益.

sentences.en: Conservationists say the losses could imperil the long - term survival of the creatures.
sentences.cn: 自然保护协会人士认为石油泄露将 长期 威胁海龟的生存.

sentences.en: I will not imperil my soul. I will uphold the justice of the Church.
sentences.cn: 我不愿使我的灵魂受到玷污, 我要维护教会法律的公正.

sentences.en: In Europe there are worries that a stratospheric euro will imperil the region's growth.
sentences.cn: 在欧洲,人们担心一直比较稳定的欧元将对欧元区的经济增长产生危害.

sentences.en: Its plunging stock price threatened spook customers and imperil the bank.
sentences.cn: 花旗暴跌的股价可能会令客户惶恐不安、令该行陷入危险中.

sentences.en: Oil spills devastate the natural environment, endanger public health, imperil drinking water and disrupt the economy.
sentences.cn: 石油泄漏破坏自然环境, 危害公众健康, 污染饮用水且扰乱经济.

sentences.en: On the former, a demand for much higher capital ratios today would imperil the recovery.
sentences.cn: 就前者而言, 大幅提高资本充足率的要求将危及复苏.

sentences.en: Pawnbrokers do not make credit checks , and using them does not imperil credit ratings.
sentences.cn: 典当行不需要信用调查, 也不会损害当户的信用记录.

sentences.en: Tax increases now might imperil economic recovery.
sentences.cn: 目前提高税收可能会危及经济的复苏。

sentences.en: To expose to danger or the chance of injury; imperil.
sentences.cn: 使陷于危险的或使危险的; 易受伤害的.
